focused on your own supply chain A change of supply chain is not taken lightly, however if needed, we expect you to be able to do itYour main responsibility in this role is to maintain and improve the quality of your supply chain You make process designs and implement new products and solutions for Cross Border Solutions CBS, the business unit that provides tailormade delivery solutions to businesses worldwide Our clients are companies looking to exportimport their products At the moment the majority of our clients are in The Netherlands, Europe and Asia CBS makes use of the PostNL logistic infrastructure, therefore your biggest challenge is to create a process design that connects the logistic operation in the Netherlands with the logistic operation abroad Taking into account the processes, the clients needs and the commercial network salesmarketing This means that you will need to become an specialist by talking to a lot of people within the organisation to get the information that you need for your designs, as well as to implement new solutions Related to this last, you are responsible for providing working solutions for our customers Therefore you will be in charge of the project coordination with regards to the implementation of new products and modifications of existing products in your supply chain You are part of a multidisciplinary team, consequently reporting to the product owner, however you manage your own responsibilities, ncluding testing and making sure that the implementation of new products is done properly Thereafter someone else will take ownershipWe want to be the preferred service provider by supporting the crossborder ecommerce market with creative and innovative solutions We want to keep it simple, smart and we want to do it together Our employees and customers are key We are always looking for ways to be better As a result, we need you to develop our supply chain To this end, you need to translate our businesss needs and models into highquality reliable solutions We are facing very interesting changes and challenges As an example our Brexit project, that requires for us to make various modifications to our existing solutions Other examples are the needed and continuous automatization of our processes for Packets, the modernization and efficiency upgrade of our network, datadriven working standardization, the improvement of the supply chain visibility, the expansion of our business in Asia and the growth of our Returns solutions In this role you get the chance of helping with these challenges and seeing how our innovations workYou are an analytical, handson problem solver with an eye for detail We are looking for a professional with the ability to see the bigger picture and at the same time being able to include the details Someone who likes to know how things work and wants to achieve goals as a team Please note that to qualify you need to have all relevant and valid working entitlements visawork permit and must currently reside in The NetherlandsWe offer you a farreaching and meaningful job Your solutions, ideas and smart plans have a direct impact on millions of customers around the DescriptionSport Data Valley SDV is a largescale project for the development of a national research and analysis platform in sports, which is being developed by research institutions from Delft, Leiden, Amsterdam and Twente, and is funded by ZonMw The SDV platform offers access to a large collection of sportspecific data, the possibility to add sport data yourself and to perform analyzes on this data There are several Sport Data Valley labs nationwide, where interested parties can get to work with sports data handson The labs have a counter function to support sport and are directly linked to established and recognized sports networks including Thialf Heerenveen, Amsterdam, Tongelreep in Eindhoven, Sport Engineering Institute in Delft, and Science lab in Leiden These labs are pivotal in a closeknit national sports ecosystem of athletes, coaches, companies, governments and knowledge institutions During your work as a software engineer you will support various Sport Data Technology and Services', 'Computer Software', 'Staffing and Recruiting']",Engineering,"Cross Border Talents is searching for a Distributed Computing Infrastructure Developer for our client in Netherlands, , The final client is the worldwide leader in semiconductors industry, counting with more than 10000 employees in its operations An ideal candidate shares the passion for technology with a customer focus looking for further development and implementation of complex and highquality technological systems, , Responsibilities of the Infrastructure Developer, , , Context, , You will work with the architects and development teams in the virtual compute platform VCP This platform is developed to host compute and analytics applications that aim to improve the yield in the semiconductor factories of our customers, , These applications take data from scanners and yield star equipment They combine this data to real time production corrections and scanner process diagnostics The corrections are sent back to the production equipment, , The platform is currently developed based on DCOS Apache Mesos We develop the platform aspects in our team Scheduling of resources, worldwide by investigating wrongs, exposing facts, offering solutions, and challenging those with power to respect rights The Media Department, which includes the Communications, Digital, Multimedia and Campaign divisions, creates and implements communications strategies to expand support for human rights, increase media coverage and influence in key markets, and reach new audiences The Digital Division is seeking a Web Developer to work on HRWs Drupal 8 website, provide technical support for webbased projects, and support the digital teams strategy This is a oneyear, fixed term position with the possibility of extension dependent on funding The position will preferably be based in New York, but any location with an overlapping time zone may be considered Due to COVID19, many of our global offices are currently closed or operating in reduced capacities The successful candidate will be required to work remotely in the interim This position reports to the Digital Director, based in Toronto Responsibilities  Implement and deploy new features to HRWs Drupal 8 website Work with the digital team and editors to troubleshoot coding issues and fix website bugs Provide technical advice and support for onlinebased projects assist in the rollout of major projects Respond quickly to reports that a webpage or pages is down or inaccessible to the public Contribute to the digital teams maintenance, testing, and deploying code to production Carry out any other tasks as required, including working with vendors and supporting security efforts Qualifications  Education  A bachelors required Related Skills and Knowledge  Proficiency with Drupal 8 and proven examples of module and theme development experience with multilingual websites a plus Proficiency with Twig templates code to production Strong adherence to security, accessibility and performance best practices Strong adherence to coding standards and documentation Ability to work in a demanding, diverse, and this role, HRW will not be able to sponsor a work visa for this role Salary and Benefits  HRW seeks exceptional applicants and offers competitive compensation and employerpaid benefits Human Rights
